lines.text: This is how you make dinosaurs?
No, this is how you play God.

[Making toy Brontosaurus and Triceratops fight]
Rawr! RAWR RAWR!
No, Charlie, those are herbavores, they... wouldn't be fighting with each other.
[picks up toy velociraptors]
Now, these, these are carnivores and they really like fighting with each other. They'll use their teeth and claws to rip each other's throats out.
Alan, he's three. Let's wait for the dinosaur lecture until he's five.
I read both of your books. I liked the first one more. Before you were on the island. You liked dinosaurs back then.
Back then they hadn't tried to eat me yet.
So Mr. Kirby, when you climbed K2, did you base camp at twenty-five or thirty thousand feet?
Thirty thousand feet, we were pretty close to the top.
You were about a thousand feet above, actually.

[Dr. Grant is giving a lecture]
Now, are there any questions?
[everyone in the audience raises their hand]
Questions not related to Jurassic Park.
[many people lower their hand]
Or the incident in San Diego, which I did not witness.
[everyone else lowers their hand]
Oh my God.
What is this?
It's a bird cage.
For what?

[the team come across a rotting carcass]
It's OK. It's dead.
[a T-Rex raises its head out of the carcass]
Nobody move a muscle.
[the T-Rex roars and the team runs off]
Shit!
Did you read Malcolm's book?
[Erik nods]
So?
I don't know. It was kinda preachy. And too much Chaos. Everything Chaos. It just seemed like the guy was high on himself.
That's two things we have in common.
Erik, I have to tell you, I'm astonished that you've lasted eight weeks on this island.

[Stunned]
... Is that all it's been?

I have a theory that there are two kinds of boys. There are those that want to be astronomers, and those that want to be astronauts. The astronomer, or the paleontologist, gets to study these amazing things from a place of complete safety.
But then you never get to go into space.
to be able to touch them. And that's... that's all that Billy wanted.
[a field of beautiful dinosaurs comes into view]
You have to believe me, this was a stupid decision, but I did it with the best intentions.

With the best intentions? Some of the worst things imaginable have been done with the best intentions. You know what, Billy? As far as I'm concerned, you're no better than the people that built this place.
Why me?
He said we needed someone who'd been on the island before.
Yes, but I did not tell you to kidnap somebody!
I have never been on this island.
Sure you have, you wrote that book.
That was Isla Nublar. This is Isla Sorna - Site B.
What are you doing? Those things are after us because of those!
Those things know we have the eggs. If I drop them in the river, they'll still be after us.
What if they catch us with them?
What if they catch us without them?
If we split up, I'm going with you guys.
Be careful with that. T-Rex. It scares some of the smaller ones away but attracts one really big one with the fin.
This is T-Rex pee?
[Eric nods yes]
How'd you get it?
You don't wanna know.
Great, just great. We're in the worst place in the world and we're not even being paid.
We haven't landed yet.
[in abandoned complex]
[goes up to snack machine and takes coins out]
Ahem... I need change here, it only takes quarters, I think I've got... I've got about ten...
[Billy breaks the glass on the snack machines with a kick and then reaches in and takes some things out]
[Paul attempts to do the same, glass doesn't break; Paul limps away]
Are you saying you wouldn't want to get on Isla Sorna and study them if you had the chance?
No force on earth or heaven could get me on that island.

[Referring to Spinosaurus]
I don't remember that one being on InGen's list.
It wasn't on their list. Which makes you wonder what else they were up to.
Either way... you probably won't get off this island alive.
We'll search for your son... in the direction that they're going.
Excellent, excellent...
On this island there is no such thing as safe.
How do you know the Kirbys?
Through our church.
[first lines]
Here you go, my friend.
Make sure you get as close as you can! I'll give you something extra if you make it a good trip!
Hey, I'm gonna get you close, my friend, but not too close, eh. You don't want to be eaten.
Daddy, Daddy, this is a herbivore and that's the Dinosaur Man.
[referring to Alan Grant]
Cooper! If you see anything, yell up!
Naw, I thought I'd keep it to myself!
Alan! ALAN!

[a loud roar rocks the jungle]
What was that?
That's a Tyrannosaurus.
I don't think so. It sounds bigger.
[last lines]
Where do you think they're going?
I don't know. Maybe just looking for new nesting grounds. It's a whole new world for them.
I dare 'em to nest in Enid, Oklahoma.
I rescued your hat.
Well... that's the important thing.
So what were you doing?
Evolving.
[repeated line]
Dr. Grant said that is a very bad idea.

[Paul and Amanda are having an argument]
Fine, go ahead and scream and when that "Tricikloplots" attacks you, don't come crying to me.
Dr. Grant, know something, Dr. Grant? Billy was right.
Reverse Darwinism - survival of the most idiotic.
